transcripts.text: Their names will be scrolled out, 1, 2, 3, 10, 20 of them at a time as they are exposed.  And one of the biggest leaders that has been in hiding shall cry out for help before the summer comes to this nation.  They will say, how could he have fallen so strongly?
Because you see, God says, I have put...
agents in their midst who will betray them and the betrayal shall hurt them so badly and pierce them so badly that they will cry out and scatter.  You've got to understand God has a plan.

Years of searching Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi led to the U.S.  mission to kill him in Syria.  It may not have happened without the help of the Kurds on the ground.  Correspondent Benjamin Hall is in northern Syria tonight with the latest details of how this mission came together.

The raid that killed Baghdadi was months in the making and involved significant intelligence from Kurdish allies in Syria, including a rare informant at the heart of ISIS.  Today, Fox News sat down with General Mazloun Abdi, the commander of the Syrian Democratic Forces in northern Syria.  He told us how they had tracked Baghdadi after the caliphate fell.
We had an informer inside ISIS who told us he moved west to Idlib and to a specific house.  We told American intelligence on May 15th, and together set up a secret cell with three Americans in it.

The SDF informant told them about the tunnels under the compound, how many people were with Baghdadi, and that he was planning to move, having already been there for months.  That's when the US carried out the attack.  This rare informant was in the compound at the time of the attack and brought out safely by the Americans.  General Mazloum also opened up about the US withdrawal and his deals with the Syrian government.
After the Americans pulled out, the Turks invaded and we had no choice but to deal with the Syrian government and Russians.  They were able to protect us.

Fox News saw this and numerous ceasefire violations firsthand.  We are now watching Syrian government forces taking up their positions right opposite Turkey.  The Kurds say that in the long run they just can't push back the Turkish army.  And what we're seeing is that partnership now in action.  We can see a Turkish tank just up at the next hamlet.  Their forces are clearly coming towards us.  That's where all the gun battles have been as well.  It's not going to be safe, I think, for us to go any further.  You can hear.  What sounds there like airstrikes?  General Mazloum also talked about the future.  He said it wasn't too late for the US to come back and protect the Kurds.
Our relationship with President Trump depends on him fulfilling his promise of protecting us.

And just hours after the raid that killed Baghdadi, another raid took place around three hours away by U.S.  forces, which killed his possible successor, Abu Hassan al-Mujiah.  We also hear from SDF forces that we may well see more ISIS leaders killed or captured in the coming days.  Brett.
Benjamin Hall, live in northern Syria, early Tuesday morning.  Benjamin, thank you.
